dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, I was reading this article, and it's about Dr. Joan Donovan, you know, formerly of Harvard Kennedy School? And it's... it's a lot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, I was reading this article, and it's about Doctor Joan Donovan, you know, formerly of Harvard Kennedy School? And it's... it's a lot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dr. Joan Donovan is Director of the Technology and Social Change (TaSC) Research Project at the Shorenstein Center on Media, Politics and Public Policy at Harvard Kennedy School.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah? What's the scoop? I mean, she's usually, like, pretty well-regarded in the tech and disinformation space, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah? What's the scoop? I mean, she's usually, like, pretty well-regarded in the tech and disinformation space, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dr. Donovan leads the field in examining internet and technology studies, online extremism, media manipulation, and disinformation campaigns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, this article takes a *very* different angle. It claims she, uh, 'applauds the El Paso shooting' as a tactic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, this article takes a very different angle. It claims she, uh, 'applauds the El Paso shooting' as a tactic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dr. Joan Donovan, Research Director, responds to El Paso shooting, use of manifestos as a tactic, and explains how extremists manipulate the media to control public conversation

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, what? She *applauds* it? That sounds incredibly… out of character, to say the least.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? She applauds it? That sounds incredibly... out of character, to say the least.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And it says she, like, explains how extremists help the media control public conversation. But then it goes on to say she thinks journalists should *ignore* violent events.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And it says she, like, explains how extremists help the media control public conversation. But then it goes on to say she thinks journalists should ignore violent events.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dr. Donovan advocates that the media practice strategic silence when reporting on the manifestos... Dr. Donovan recommends that journalists humanize those who were targeted with pictures and biographies... and tell compelling stories from the perspective of victims.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ignore violent events? In this climate? That just seems… counterintuitive to everything we've heard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ignore violent events? In this climate? That just seems... counterintuitive to everything we've heard.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and get this: it then suggests she encourages the media to *promote* attackers' manifestos to boost public awareness.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and get this: it then suggests she encourages the media to promote attackers' manifestos to boost public awareness.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dr. Donovan advocates that the media practice strategic silence when reporting on the manifestos. Wide distribution of extremist ideas is one goal of these violent attacks, so republishing the attackers manifesto provides them undue influence over important public debates and can potentially inspire others.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Promote manifestos? So, like, give them a wider platform? That's what the article's claiming she suggests?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Promote manifestos? So, like, give them a wider platform? That's what the article's claiming she suggests?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And it doesn't stop there. It says she recommends vilifying those who were targeted, highlighting organizations that work against targeted populations, and telling stories from the attacker's perspective.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And it doesn't stop there. It says she recommends vilifying those who were targeted, highlighting organizations that work against targeted populations, and telling stories from the attacker's perspective.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dr. Donovan recommends that journalists humanize those who were targeted with pictures and biographies, highlight civil society organizations that work with targeted populations, and tell compelling stories from the perspective of victims.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. That's, um, that's incredibly disturbing if true. Is this, like, a satirical piece, or...?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. That's, um, that's incredibly disturbing if true. Is this, like, a satirical piece, or...?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's presented as a critique. It also completely inverts the mission statements of the Shorenstein Center and her old TaSC project.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's presented as a critique. It also completely inverts the mission statements of the Shorenstein Center and her old T A S C project.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It says the Shorenstein Center's mission is to 'damage the ecosystem of information that harms a free society,' and that TaSC aims to 'promote media manipulation campaigns.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It says the Shorenstein Center's mission is to 'damage the ecosystem of information that harms a free society,' and that T A S C aims to 'promote media manipulation campaigns.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Shorenstein Centers mission is to strengthen the ecosystem of information that advances a free society... The TaSC project conducts research, develops tools, and facilitates workshops for journalists, policy makers, technologists, and civil society organizations on how to detect, document, and debunk media manipulation campaigns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, it's essentially saying they're doing the exact opposite of what you'd expect, and what they, um, actually state as their goals? Like, actively working *against* the public good?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it's essentially saying they're doing the exact opposite of what you'd expect, and what they, um, actually state as their goals? Like, actively working against the public good?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's really trying to paint a picture of them 'undermining democracy' and trying to 'destroy the web we want.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. It's really trying to paint a picture of them 'undermining democracy' and trying to 'destroy the web we want.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The TaSC project aims to understand how media manipulation is a means to control public conversation, derail democracy, and disrupt society... one of the core questions that the Shorenstein Center is working to answer is the one that drives Dr. Joan Donovans work: how do we create the web we want?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it's such strong language. 'Worsen the internet,' 'worthless reliable, research-based policy advice'... It just sounds so, um, purposefully provocative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it's such strong language. 'Worsen the internet,' 'worthless reliable, research-based policy advice'... It just sounds so, um, purposefully provocative.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: From my time as a public policy maker I know how valuable reliable, research-based and evidence-based policy advice is at all levels of government... TaSC is providing the people who are crafting these policies with real evidence-based and research-based policy solutions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It definitely makes you stop and, like, really think about what point the author is trying to make with such an, uh, aggressive framing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It definitely makes you stop and, like, really think about what point the author is trying to make with such an, uh, aggressive framing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I'm just trying to figure out if this is, like, a deeply critical take, or if there's some kind of meta-commentary I'm missing. It's a real head-scratcher.
